metadata.titel_preek: Easter Season Sermons: The Night, The Wound, and The Whirlwind

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the realm of Death and human despair to restore life and create faith where it was impossible.

tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The living Son of God had appeared to him personally.
God has entered our pain and been wounded by it.
receive the gift of eternal light and life in his name
grant his divine life to all who come to him
the light of the incarnate Word of God comes to shine
the living Word of God, which is unique and trustworthy
the Lord looks straight through Thomas... to you and to me

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word / The Wounds of Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith
it was the sign of his sufferings
the night in which Sin and Death reign
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is described as an irrevocable kingdom and a 'cold clasp' that no human effort can escape.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of faith and confession following the encounter with the Risen Christ.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / Mary / Thomas / Job
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human response is always a reaction to the prior action of God appearing or speaking.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus has entered the realm of Death.
God has come to meet Job.
The living Son of God had appeared to him personally.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mary Magdalene came to the tomb.
We can choose a god who suits us.

voorbeelden: he must rise from the dead
Job's great longing is for revelation.
they did not know the scripture
having power to grant his divine life
God has a power that he cannot discern

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's ability (Pouvoir) to do what man cannot (overcome death).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Night) to ~S2 (Empty Tomb) to S1 (Risen Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies S2 to destroy it from within, moving the believer to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Death is treated as an ontological reality, not a metaphor.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the primary actor who initiates salvation and faith.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We have a real choice. We can choose a god who suits us...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Faith as a gift/creation of the Spirit
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Thomas and Job are not models of behavior but recipients of revelation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God reveals Himself to the doubting and the suffering.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; comfort in 'being dust' because God is God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from human incapacity to divine action is seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit creates the 'Pouvoir' (ability) to believe.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to the 'Power of Darkness' and 'Death'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject, Death is the Opponent, and Man is the Receiver.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology precedes and enables the response of faith.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids all pitfalls of moralism by making the 'Night' real and God's 'Light' an invasive, sovereign act.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would look at the 'Night' metaphor, semiotics shows the 'Night' functions as a literal Actant (Opponent).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of 'tomb' to show the functional role of the tomb as the site of the Subject's victory.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'faith' of Thomas is not a human achievement but an Object given by the Subject (Jesus) through a specific Helper (the Wounds).

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace almost perfectly.
